clues.clue: Oh my God!  It's a double rainbow video!  Seen by more than 19.3 million people on this site!  What does this mean?!
Nora Ephron is editor at large for this political site co-founded by Arianna
The home page of this 5-letter site says "talk for hours"; this-to-this "calls are free"
This satiric site says, "Facebook, Twitter Revolutionizing How Parents Stalk Their College-Aged Kids"
A sign reading "children left unattended will be towed away at owner's expense" is seen at thisblog.org

The name of this tequila cocktail is also a first name, the one Rita Hayworth was given at birth
It's the Spanish word for a donkey, especially one used as a pack animal
Similar to a poncho, it's the Spanish name for a blanketlike shawl
A picador is the mounted assistant to this, a synonym for bullfighter & torero
This Spanish word for a chain of mountains means "saw": the peaks suggest the teeth of a saw
In 2009 a bank in this Buckeye State got tipped off to a robbery when a man in a ski mask waited patiently in line
A man called the home he just robbed in this Arkansas capital to say he dropped his wallet there & wanted it back
In 2009 a thief broke into an NBC news van; in failing to steal a bolted-down camera, he hit this button by mistake
3 Penn. muggers stole an iPhone but didn't turn off this 3-letter feature, which cops used to track & catch them
A Minnesota man got a DUI for driving not a car but a redesigned recliner from this hyphenated Co.; it could go 20 mph
The territory of one of these wolf family units can extend more than 1,000 square milesl
It's the "woody" alternate name for the gray wolf
Some experts believe the smaller red wolf to be a hybrid of the gray wolf & this wily relative
In 1995 wolves from Canada were reintroduced into this U.S. national park
The Abyssinian wolf, native to the highlands of this country, is also called the simian jackal
Of this "We Are The World" co-writer: Miles, Sofia & Nicole
Of this composer: 20(!) of us, including 5 Johanns & 2 Johannas
Of this painter: Paulo, Maya, Claude & Paloma
Of this monarch: Mary, Elizabeth, Edward
"This land is your land, this land is my land, from" here "to the New York island"
In 1946 Churchill said, "From Stettin in" this north European sea "to Trieste... an iron curtain has descended"
Found in the Bible, the phrase "from Dan to Beersheba" refers to an area now within this country
A book on "the Vietnam War in American film" is titled "From" this city "to Hollywood"
(Kelly of the Clue Crew shows a map of Great Britain on the monitor.)  Proverbially, to walk Great Britain end to end, go from John o' Groats in Scotland to Land's End in this county

NBC moved the London-set "Steptoe and Son" to Los Angeles & rechristened it this
Basil & Sybil ran this title place with a little help from Manuel the waiter & his pet rat

The success of "Little Women" prompted her to write in her journal, "paid up all the debts, thank the lord!"
Besides the title role in "The Bride of Frankenstein", Elsa Lanchester also played this writer
Her novel "The Fountainhead" was rejected by 12 publishers, some of whom declared it too controversial
Her "To the Lighthouse" revolves around visits by the Ramsay family to its summer home on the Isle of Skye
She was 38 when her first works of fiction were published; "Adam Bede" came out 2 years later

In MVP, when we're talking sports
In the cabinet department known as the VA for short
In VIN down at the dealership
In the national service program originally founded as VISTA
In the broadcasting service known as the VOA

final_jeopardy.clue: Of the 50 on the list, only one never appears on screen: man, from this 1942 animated feature
